results.title: Grumpy old man
results.creator_credit: Richard Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Richard Bailey has nudged and niggled people and he’s had some success, especially on the asbestos issue. A heart attack in 2003 meant that Bailey couldn’t be as active anymore, so he decided to direct his energies elsewhere.

results.title: Days of clear water
results.creator_credit: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Emma describes her life growing up with her nan, an independent lady who loved to tend to her garden and go for walks along the river. When her nan passed away, Emma lost not only her nan but her best friend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Awkward customers (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
John Cleese and Angharad Rees play two sales assistants who demonstrate how to handle awkward customers. Shows the customer in a temper, the compulsive talker and the rude, aggressive and offensive customer. John Barron, June Whitfield and George A. Cooper appear as the awkward customers. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

group_siblings.title: More awkward customers (NP)

results.title: More awkward customers (NP)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
Emphasises the importance of professional knowledge of an organisation’s stocks or services in dealing with difficult customers. Highlights the customer who parades their knowledge, the silent customer who cannot communicate his needs and the finicky customer who requires every detail. Features John Cleese, Anghared Rees, Patricia Routledge, Bernard Cribbins and Lyn Redgrave. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: In two minds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Customer Relations in Practice”.
A basic training course for all staff who deal face to face with customers in any service industry. Shows how there is a danger of misunderstanding whenever two people begin a “sales conversation”. The problem is that the assistant does not know what the customer really needs and the customer does not know all the ways the assistant can meet these needs. Demonstrates with clarity and with humour that it is the assistant’s job to resolve both sets of uncertainty. Stars John Cleese. Narrated by Philip Bond.

results.title: Crash Zone: Big Business
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Max Dann, Patricia Edgar, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Marcello tries to make money selling Ram’s new invention. Ram, realising Marcello is ripping him off, dissolves the partnership and then sells one of his amazing new game converters to a strange girl, Louise. Unfortunately Louise’s TV blows up and she blames Ram. Will the other kids be able to save Ram before he becomes a meal for Louise’s huge dog, ‘Predator’?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Identity Crisis
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Philip Dalkin, Patricia Edgar, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Testing Alex’s new game, ‘Trillin’, the kids encounter Virgil, who is having an identity crisis. The surprised Alex is worried that Virgil might be a spy for rival company Sunijim. An offended Virgil gets the kids to help him prove he’s not a spy - but Virgil can’t remember who he really is! The kids discover Virgil has actually grown from a program created by Alex.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: The Shadow
results.creator_credit: Pino Amenta, Anthony Morris, Patricia Edgar, Buena Vista International, Disney Channel and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Marcello throws Catalyst into uproar when he hacks into Alex’s system. Alex brings in legendary hacker-tracker J.D. Moon to find the security breach. Marcello is too scared to own up to his foolishness and as J.D. Moon gets closer to the truth, the kids have to choose whether to help Marcello or not. When Alex discovers the truth, she fires Marcello.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.
